SENT.plain: Sustained narrow-QRS tachycardia of three months duration and left ventricular systolic dysfunction were identified in a fifteen-year-old Quarter Horse
No underlying cause for the tachyarrhythmia was found and no predisposing structural cardiac lesions were evident by echocardiography
Intravenous diltiazem and lidocaine were administered without achieving successful conversion of the arrhythmia
Oral quinidine therapy converted the tachyarrhythmia to sinus rhythm
Ventricular systolic dysfunction and chamber dilatation subsequently resolved
As with other species, echocardiographic features of dilated cardiomyopathy can be tachycardia-induced and may resolve following successful control of heart rate and rhythm
